intro: Quaqua swanepoelii, commonly known as the Cape fennel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. Its aromatic foliage and showy flowers make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening.
